!

We have reports that the Red Raiders are active again.
Launa found a clue about the identity of their mysterious leader.

Commander Gislan is eager to launch full-scale assault against them as soon as we confirm her information.

Still have hard feelings toward him? Aid Launa and help us wipe out the raiders, and Gislan will come around.
The realm needs you.
I will be waiting.

- Seir

[Entering Dark Reach Citadel requires item level 446 or higher.]

<PCNAME> answered the federation's call and pursued the Red Raiders, with Launa in tow. During the investigation, <PCNAME> found a lead suggesting a connection between the Red Raiders and Leander at Dark Reach Citadel.

You came, !

Launa finally tracked down a lead about the mastermind behind the Red Raiders.

She wants backup. I could not think of anyone but you.

She can tell you all the details.
Go to Tulufan. You will find her there.

! Well, this will be easier than I thought! Thank you, Seir!

He sent you, right?
"This lead you found, what is it?"

Keep this just between us.

Somehow, Leander is involved with the Red Raiders.

Leander was the former expedition leader to the Island of Dawn, until he went missing.
Something is not right about his disappearance.

We now know that the mastermind behind the Red Raiders came to the fore right after Leander disappeared!

That can't be a coincidence."Are you saying Leander leads the Red Raiders?"

Let's not jump to any conclusions.
That's why we're here, thoughâ€”to either confirm or disprove that information.

Let's start in the Colossal Ruins. We have a number of reports that the Red Raiders are active there."Let's do this."

Elsine is nearby.

She was the last person to see Leander before he went missing.
She might have useful information.

Can you talk to her?
Are you here about Leander?<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"What?"</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

I'm helping out with an investigation.
It's about an unidentified man who brought an ancient weapon to Velika.

If you are not here for it, just go.
I am very busy now."Spare me few minutes. This is about your cousin, Leander."

Leander?

I'm not sure I can offer you any useful information, beyond what I said at the time.

After Elleon went missing, Leander became obsessed with searching for him. He lost all interest in everything else: the expedition, his academic career... none of it mattered anymore."Was Leander searching for Elleon by himself?"

Not at first.

I remember that he was incredibly furious at the federation. He invested a large amount of gold, hiring investigators, following leads, whatever might have helped him find Elleon. The federation's search did not yield anything.

I do not know whether Leander still contributes to the federation, but last time we met, he said he lost faith in their leadership.
I have not seen him since, but it is possible Leander went on his own way to find Elleon.

Leander is a good man. He just wants to know if Elleon is alive.

So, Leander might harbor a grievance against the federation?

That's promising, but it's not proof that he leads the Red Raiders.
Let's dig in some more. My gut tells me he has something to do with the Red Raiders.

Camp Marrakeen just contacted me. They might have a lead.

, we're on our way to Camp Marrakeen!

! I am honored to meet you.
But we might have been premature about that lead; our source is being difficult.

As you probably know, gutrends are in league with the Red Raiders.

They are superstitious beasts, devoted only to their so-called prophecy. So we captured Kunchara, who has a reputation for being a hoaxter. The savage is as stubborn as he is deceitful.

We cannot just let him go. We'll find a way to get the truth out of him, whatever it takes.

Kunchara never forgets.
The federation helped Kunchara.
Gutrends do not harm the federation.

Some gutrends are raiders. My gutrends are not raiders.
Kunchara speaks true. Trust Kunchara!"Why should I believe you?"

Kunchara saw. This is true.

At Sietch Bidaum, Kunchara saw weird people.
Man in black, commanding gutrends.
Bad gutrends. They harm The federation.

My gutrends, you can trust.

Only Kunchara knows this information. Kunchara can be friend.
Kunchara cannot lie. If Kunchara lies, god will never speak to Kunchara again.
Kunchara promises, on Kunchara's prophecy staff. Break it, should Kunchara lie.

, I am starting to think the federation overvalued you.
What took you so long?"What are these wagons?"

Red Raiders.
The cargo wasn't touched.

Monsters' work, most certainly. They attacked while the Red Raiders were transporting their cargos."You sure these belong to the Red Raiders?"

Obvious, is it not?

The cargo includes ancient relics, recently stolen by the Red Raiders.

Search the bodies.
They're bound to provide some solid clues.
Go on, have a look.

(Launa reads the document.)
Huh... Kunchara spoke the truth.

I found something, too.
Let's see... a list of sites to search, and the destination of the relics they pillage.

Goodness! Dark Reach Citadel? The ancient giant ruins?

I'll go back to the outpost and set Kunchara free.
I promised to release him if he told us the truth.

I will mark the location on your map.
You go there and find the raiders.
Godspeed, .
(Powerful magic surrounds the orb.)

(Pages are bloodstained, with only a few words legible.)

...Definition...
...demons...(...create...! ...portal...
Theory suggests...! ...ritual...
...must...!)...complete...

Are we not supposed to find the Red Raiders?
, where have you been?"I found them. They're inside the fort."

You finished the reconnaissance already?

Any sign of Leander?Hand over the forbidden tome, and explain what happened.

It cannot be!
This book is sanctioned!
Yes, Leander is a demonology expert.
But his expertise is only academic.
It is hard to believe Leander sacrificed his followers to summon a demon.

Leander's mysterious backer... he sounds very fishy.
We must stop them before more lives are lost.

Good work, .
I will study this book further.
